app.cards.game

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.cards.game.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object

    This class represents a poker hand (hole cards + community cards) and offers a method for evaluating the value of that hand (evaluate()).

    A Hand can either be created via the constructor Hand(Set) supplying a Set of Card objects or via one of several static creation methods (fromCards(Card...), fromCards(Set, Card...), fromCards(Set, Set) or fromShortcuts(String...)). Also, Cards can be added to the Hand later on via addCard(Card) or setCards(Set).

    Every Hand object is automatically assigned a UUID upon creation that can be used to later track down the "source" Hand of a HandResult as returned by evaluate().

      • Hand

        public Hand(java.util.Set<Card> cards)
        Creates a new Hand from a Set of Cards
        Parameters:
        cards - Cards to be used in the hand
        Throws:
        IllegalHandException - if cards.size() > MAX_NUMBER_OF_CARDS_PER_HAND

      • fromShortcuts

        public static Hand fromShortcuts(java.lang.String... shortcuts)
        Creates a new Hand from the supplied shortcuts
        Parameters:
        shortcuts - shortcuts for all Cards to be used in this hand
        Returns:
        The newly created Hand object
        Throws:
        IllegalHandException - if the number of supplied shortcuts is greater than MAX_NUMBER_OF_CARDS_PER_HAND
        See Also:

      • fromCards

        public static Hand fromCards(Card... cards)
        Creates a new Hand from the supplied Cards
        Parameters:
        cards - all Cards to be used in this hand
        Returns:
        The newly created Hand object
        Throws:
        IllegalHandException - if the number of supplied Cards is greater than MAX_NUMBER_OF_CARDS_PER_HAND

      • fromCards

        public static Hand fromCards(java.util.Set<Card> baseCards,
             Card... holeCards)

        Creates a new Hand from all the supplied Cards

        Can be used as a convenience method in case the client code holds boards cards and hole cards in different data structures. All supplied Cards will be merged into one Set from which the Hand will be created.

        Parameters:
        baseCards - Cards used as the community cards
        holeCards - Cards used as the hole cards of a player
        Returns:
        The newly created Hand object
        Throws:
        IllegalHandException - if the total number of supplied Cards is greater than MAX_NUMBER_OF_CARDS_PER_HAND

      • fromCards

        public static Hand fromCards(java.util.Set<Card> baseCards,
             java.util.Set<Card> holeCards)

        Creates a new Hand from all the supplied Cards

        Can be used as a convenience method in case the client code holds boards cards and hole cards in different data structures. All supplied Cards will be merged into one Set from which the Hand will be created.

        Parameters:
        baseCards - Cards used as the community cards
        holeCards - Cards used as the hole cards of a player
        Returns:
        The newly created Hand object
        Throws:
        IllegalHandException - if the total number of supplied Cards is greater than MAX_NUMBER_OF_CARDS_PER_HAND

      • randomHand

        public static Hand randomHand(int numberOfCards)
        Creates a new Hand with random Cards
        Parameters:
        numberOfCards - number of random Cards to be generated for the Hand
        Returns:
        The newly created Hand
        Throws:
        AllCardsDealtException - if numberOfCards is greater than the total number of cards in the deck

      • getId

        See Also:

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)

        Set the ID of this Hand

        The ID will be passed into the HandResult object when evaluate() is called to allow for hand tracking. If the client code holds a player's name associated with this hand, it could be reasonable to use that as the Hand's ID to be able to later identify which player's Hand yielded which HandResult.

        By default, a UUID is automatically generated upon creation of a Hand.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID to be used for this Hand

      • evaluate

        public HandResult evaluate()
        Evaluate the Cards of this Hand and report the result as a HandResult
        Returns:
        The HandResult encapsulating the type of hand found and a detailed breakdown. The HandResult will also be passed this Hand's ID to allow for identifying which Hand has generated the HandResult.
        Throws:
        InvalidHandEvaluationException - if none of the HandTypes could be identified within this Hand's cards
